intro: Phacelia magellanica f. jepsonii, commonly known as the Magellan phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
